column5: Heading to the basement to pull my gear together (one yearolds sure eat into fishin', and fishin' prep time). I know there has been very little rain, but it has been above zero for three days now.  Who was out today?  What is the ice like today?  Any issues near shore?  Who's going out Saturday?
They were showing open water at the shoreline on the news last night.  I think it was Innisfil. I don't think I'd trust the main lake but Cooks and other first to freeze areas should be fine.

It will be fine. Below zero at night will freeze anything that thaws during the day. Just be careful coming off in the afternoon around shore. I'm sure some bozo will put a car or something thru the access this weekend.  S.

The news always shows the worst of the worst. I'm sure they got all their 'spectacular" footage at the very end of the day after everyone and their brother had run over the shore. I know personally, I'll be running my sled all over tomorrow. Both ATV's and sleds were running up and down IBP and BBP today. 6:30am tomorrow can't come fast enough!  Cheers, Colin
I was out of Gilford today, I think the road was 2nd line, was on the ice around noon and off just before 3, no problems at the shore and I found 8" or so of ice wherever i punched a hole.  ryan
I'm headin out tomorrow from Alcona.  Taking the sled.  Head for whities in the morning.
I was out at IBP today no trouble with the ice 7 inches was the norm. Slush on the way home was 1/2 inch with no deteriation to the ice.

I fished Port Bolster today.  No issues with the ice.  Slight bit of slush on the top in the morning, but temp seemed to drop a bit during the day and it was crusting back up.  Solid 8" everywhere we went today.  Cheers  Craig
Thanks for the updates. Tight lines.
Everybody knows that the Bird is the Word!!!
i was out there today....solid 6-7" of ice.
